channel.title: CNN.com
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: U.S. court debates sweeping health care law
item.description: A controversial and sweeping health reform law championed by U.S. President Barack Obama faces a challenge in the country's Supreme Court.

item.title: Syrian opposition bids for unity
item.description: Disjointed factions of the Syrian opposition are meeting in Istanbul in a bid to form a unified voice ahead of next week's "Friends of Syria" conference.

item.title: Who could take over after al-Assad?
item.description: For 12 bloody, horrific months, Syrian dissidents and world leaders have dreamt of one outcome for the Syrian crisis: the ousting of President Bashar al-Assad. But who would take over the embattled country remains a mystery.

item.title: N. Korea 'moves rocket to launch pad'
item.description: Hours after President Obama says North Korea will achieve nothing with threats, Pyongyang moves a long-range rocket to a launch pad, a South Korean official says.

item.title: Taxi clue to London banker shooting
item.description: Police hunting the would-be killer of a Russian ex-banker appeal for help to trace the taxi driver who dropped him off before he was shot near his London home.

item.title: Florida killing: Calls for justice rage on
item.description: A month Monday, Trayvon Martin died.

item.title: Siege gunman's brother 'outraged'
item.description: The brother of a gunman killed in a siege in France is outraged to be charged over the alleged shooting spree by Mohammed Merah, above, his lawyer says.

item.title: Gunman in Afghan army uniform kills 2
item.description: A gunman wearing an Afghan army uniform killed two international service members in southern Afghanistan on Monday, NATO said, before coalition forces shot him dead.

item.title: Afghan suspect's wife: 'He'd not do that'
item.description: The U.S. Army soldier charged with killing 17 Afghan civilians "would not do that," his wife said.

item.title: Pope heads to Cuba after Mexico visit
item.description: In the second papal visit to the island nation, Pope Benedict heads to Cuba on Monday, the long-awaited leg of a tour he's so far proven he intends to use for addressing faith and political issues.
